segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 6
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 6

segments.pli: 3. Anuttariyavagga
segments.en: 3. Unsurpassable

segments.pli: 21. Sāmakasutta
segments.en: 21. At Sāma Village

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati sāmagāmake pokkharaṇiyāyaṃ.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying among the Sakyans near the little village of Sāma, by a lotus pond.

segments.pli: Atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ pokkharaṇiyaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire lotus pond, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,

segments.pli: “Tayome, bhante, dhammā bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “Sir, three qualities lead to the decline of a mendicant.

segments.pli: Katame tayo?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Kammārāmatā, bhassārāmatā, niddārāmatā—
segments.en: Relishing work, talk, and sleep.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhante, tayo dhammā bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These three qualities lead to the decline of a mendicant.”

segments.pli: Idamavoca sā devatā.
segments.en: That’s what that deity said,

segments.pli: Samanuñño satthā ahosi.
segments.en: and the teacher approved.

segments.pli: Atha kho sā devatā “samanuñño me satthā”ti bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
segments.en: Then that deity, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tassā rattiyā accayena bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened, adding:

segments.pli: “imaṃ, bhikkhave, rattiṃ aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ pokkharaṇiyaṃ obhāsetvā yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, sā devatā maṃ etadavoca:
‘tayome, bhante, dhammā bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
Katame tayo?
Kammārāmatā, bhassārāmatā, niddārāmatā—
ime kho, bhante, tayo dhammā bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattantī’ti.
Idamavoca, bhikkhave, sā devatā.
Idaṃ vatvā maṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
Tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, alābhā tesaṃ dulladdhaṃ, ye vo devatāpi jānanti kusalehi dhammehi parihāyamāne.
segments.en: “It’s unfortunate for those of you who even the deities know are declining in skillful qualities.

segments.pli: Aparepi, bhikkhave, tayo parihāniye dhamme desessāmi.
segments.en: I will teach you three more qualities that lead to decline.

segments.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “katame ca, bhikkhave, tayo parihāniyā dhammā?
segments.en: “And what, mendicants, are three qualities that lead to decline?

segments.pli: Saṅgaṇikārāmatā, dovacassatā, pāpamittatā—
segments.en: Enjoyment of company, being hard to admonish, and having bad friends.

segments.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo parihāniyā dhammā.
segments.en: These three qualities lead to decline.

segments.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, atītamaddhānaṃ parihāyiṃsu kusalehi dhammehi, sabbete imeheva chahi dhammehi parihāyiṃsu kusalehi dhammehi.
segments.en: Whether in the past, future, or present, all those who decline in skillful qualities do so because of these six qualities.”

segments.pli: Yepi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ parihāyissanti kusalehi dhammehi, sabbete imeheva chahi dhammehi parihāyissanti kusalehi dhammehi.
Yepi hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi parihāyanti kusalehi dhammehi, sabbete imeheva chahi dhammehi parihāyanti kusalehi dhammehī”ti.
Paṭhamaṃ.
